qas.question: What group initially made use of asphalt?
For what purpose did American Indians use asphalt?
What sort of deposits does asphalt overlay?
What would early users of asphalt want to achieve by putting it on baskets?
On what type of boat was asphalt used to seal planks?
The foreign people were the first to use what in the New World?
What group was the first to use shell beads?
What was used on shell beads to adhere gourds?
What was used on turtle shells to provide decorations?
What was used on turtle shells as a sealant?

context: The first use of <b5_0>asphalt/bitumen<b5_0/> in the New World was by <a0_0><b6_0>indigenous peoples<b6_0/><a0_0/>. On the west coast, as early as the 13th century, the Tongva, Luiseño and Chumash peoples collected the naturally occurring <b7_0><b9_0>asphalt/bitumen<b9_0/><b7_0/> that seeped to the surface above underlying <a2_0>petroleum<a2_0/> deposits. All three used the substance as an <a1_0>adhesive<a1_0/>. It is found on many different artifacts of tools and ceremonial items. For example, it was used on rattles to adhere gourds or turtle shells to rattle handles. It was also used in decorations. <b8_0>Small round shell beads<b8_0/> were often set in asphaltum to provide decorations. It was used as a sealant on baskets to make them <a3_0>watertight<a3_0/> for carrying water. Asphaltum was used also to seal the planks on ocean-going <a4_0>canoes<a4_0/>.
